channel.title: Adding npc
channel.description: alright i know how to edit npc locations and dialogs and what not, but how do i add a completely new one? i have a rough idea, but i cant find the area where it lists npc locations, where are locations (x, y cordinates) found? what file? and also, how come it doesnt allow me to open a .cfg file, it goes online to "find a file type to open the file with". it goes online and i get error 404, url not found, i mainly need help with the first part, i just listed off my other problems too. if anyone can help with any of this please post[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 03:10:18 PM[/size][hr]will anyone help?..-.-[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 03:11:55 PM[/size][hr]no help?

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @Le_Hawtz Le Hawtz
item.description:
@Le_Hawtz wrote:

ok but why isnt it working, i put 0s for all the range, i compiled and it was error free, why wont the npc spawn[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 03:40:52 PM[/size][hr]please help me!

Read full topic

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

the range is where the npc will walk to and from and the 0 means it wont walk it will just stay in the location its spawned

Read full topic

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

When You Click on A .cfg It loads the please choose file to open with right… use notepad or wordpad…
you should get something that looks like this…

then add something that looks like this …

spawn = NPCIDHERE  YCOORD	XCOORD HEIGHT OF NPC  0	0 0 0 0    NPCNAMEHERE

heres what the finished one should look something like

spawn = 2745	2375	5068	0	3104	5068	3104	5068	1	Jad

Read full topic

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Le Hawtz:

ok thats all fine and dandy but how do i change .cfg to .txt

Already told you how

[quote=“Nirvana.Marijuana, post:6, topic:64420”][quote author=O M G link=topic=93402.msg971785#msg971785 date=1173061183]
In your server use ::mypos and to get the X and Y
[/quote]

Unless its under your energy left like on my server[/quote]

That too :P[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 03:23:26 PM[/size][hr][quote=“skullsy, post:9, topic:64420”]rightclick autospawn.cfg and click rename and name it autospawn.txt[/quote]

You don’t even need to save it as a text file

Read full topic

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Yeh if you use tab in the post it just goes to a button like tab would usually

You don’t have to save it as a .txt, but if for some reason you feel like it open the CFG and click save as npc and that it, it saves as .txt automatically

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @Nirvana.Marijuana Nirvana.Marijuana
item.description:
@Nirvana.Marijuana wrote:

npc.cfg

PS. very important to use [glow=red,2,300]TAB[/glow] NOT SPACES (or it wont work :eek:)

[hr][br]

[quote=“skullsy, post:2, topic:64420”]To open a .cfg file, rename .cfg to .txt, than edit it, than change it back to .cfg. To add an npc, open your autospawn.cfg, than add this above [end of spawnlist]

spawn = (npcid)	(spawnpoint x)	(point Y)	0	0	0	0	0	2	(npc name)

No you just double click the npc.cfg

Read full topic

item.title: Adding npc
item.dc:creator: @skullsy skullsy
item.description:
@skullsy wrote:

To open a .cfg file, rename .cfg to .txt, than edit it, than change it back to .cfg. To add an npc, open your autospawn.cfg, than add this above [end of spawnlist]

spawn = (npcid)	(spawnpoint x)	(point Y)	0	0	0	0	0	2	(npc name)

Read full topic
